1. Install Rcpp from CRAN
2. Download the latest RF-ACE source and save it to directory "rfacer/"
3. Call "R CMD INSTALL rfacer" in the directory where "rfacer/" exists 

Now, once you include library "rfacer" in the R script, you should have access to the following functions

rface.filter()
rface.train()
rface.test()
rface.save()
rface.load()
